 - Python version 3.9.12
 - Cython version 0.29.25

comment_data.body:
This looks to be an issue with your Numpy configuration rather than a Cython bug. The tests seem to be passing correctly on our GitHub actions.

> Python version 3.9.12

and

> File "/usr/lib64/python3.8/site-packages/numpy/distutils/npy_pkg_config.py"


look mutually contradictory to me (you aren't using the Python version you think you are).

I'll close this for now but we can reopen it if you can provide good evidence that is a Cython bug.
I did check this on my laptop (which is coincidently also Python 3.8.12 on x86_64 Linux) and it works fine for me so I'm pretty sure this is an issue with your Numpy install.
OK. Which one version of the `numpy` you have installed?

1.21.2.

But the Cython CI looks to have 1.21.4: https://github.com/cython/cython/runs/4430281784?check_suite_focus=true#step:5:231

So in my case it is (as I wrote) 1.21.4:
```console
[tkloczko@ss-desktop SRPMS]$ pip show numpy
Name: numpy
Version: 1.21.4
Summary: NumPy is the fundamental package for array computing with Python.
Home-page: https://www.numpy.org
Author: Travis E. Oliphant et al.
Author-email:
License: BSD
Location: /usr/lib64/python3.8/site-packages
Requires:
Required-by: colorspacious, pandas
```
I cannot reopen this ticket .. can you?
What is your linux distro and version? Are you building NumPy locally or using one of the official wheels/conda packages? If you are building locally how exactly did you build and install it?

I'm numpy building locally using setuptools.
Just made new package to with changed packaging process to go over pep517 because in your case you are using .whl file.

Good news.
After switching `numpy` build procedure to use pep517 cython test suite passes without issues.

Thank you.
